Detailed Description

HttpConnection is a very fundamental class to execute a Http request.

HttpConnection turns an HttpRequest into data stream, then send it to the HTTP server that specified in HttpRequest and get the response back, turns the response data stream. HttpConnection itself is a derived-class of HttpResponse, beacuse it can only handle one connection, be a HttpResponse also simplify the usage of HttpConnection. It doesn't handle redirect, auth, store cookies.

Signal handler for SIGPIPE is necessary when using HttpConnection. Signal handler function (sigpipeHandler) will be invoked by following code: signal(SIGPIPE,sigpipeHandler); OR just ignore SIGPIPE signal by using signal(SIGPIPE,SIG_IGN)

A simplest example: 

   HttpConnection connection;
   RESULT rv = connection.doConnect("http://www.yahoo.com/");
   while (connection.readData(&buffer, 1024, &len) != RESULT::EOF) {
     fwrite(&buffer, 1, len, stdout);
   }

Member Function Documentation

HttpResponse* gaia::net::HttpConnection::doConnect ( const HttpRequest &  req)

Execute the request, and write response back to user.

Returns error only when connection is broken, that is, routing error, DNS error, host unreachable, connection reset...etc. If remote host is reachable and connection is setup correctly while remote host returns 4xx (page not found, need auth...), or 5xx (internal error...), the result code will be OK, and user can determine if server's response usable by checking status code in response.

Parameters:
reqRequest of this connction.
Returns:
A ponter that receive the response data, caller is responsible for deleting the object.
HttpResponse* gaia::net::HttpConnection::doConnect ( const gaia::base::String &  urlString)

Returns:
A ponter that receive the response data, caller is responsible for deleting the object.

void gaia::net::HttpConnection::initTimeout ( )

RESULT gaia::net::HttpConnection::setParameterString ( HttpConnectionOption  option,
const gaia::base::String &  value 
)

Set string-typed option.

user-agent: set option to HTTP_CONNECT_USER_AGENT, and fill desired user agent string into value. If user-agent also set in request header, one in request will be overrided, unless HTTP_CONNECT_USER_AGENT is "". If HTTP_CONNECT_USER_AGENT is set to "", user agent would not shown.

Parameters:
optionOption name.
valueValue of this option.
Returns:
An error code.
